item.description:
The Harvard Film Archive is running a series of films with screenplays by acclaimed British playwright Harold Pinter and "Accident"(1967) directed by Joseph Losey (actually a Wisconsin-born American, I was surprised by this) is among his finest.

This harrowing tale, is set at Oxford University: "As a car accident agitates the relationship between six people (three men, two women and a girl) in Oxford, implicit waves of suspicion emerge, drawing the whole group into a complex web of self-destructive tendencies. The circular structure of the film is determined by the accident which, although unimportant in itself, is a beginning and an end of the emotional turmoil which permeates the lives of all six of them. This psychological turbulence is skillfully veiled by the aristocratic climate of Oxford" Edinburgh Univ. Film Society

Here is The Allmovie review: http://www.allmovie.c...
and Roger Ebert's: http://rogerebert.sun...

While the tone of the movie is somber and a bit disturbing I do believe that the topics addressed in this film will lead to quite an engaging post-film discussion.

As is the custom, Tom will be holding a Meetup sign near the front row after the movie and then its off to a local restaurant to discuss.
item.name: Accident at HFA
